topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitoring the Drive Audit

othermeta.name: role
othermeta.content: Karthik P, Keshava HPE Binamra S

body.p: Drive audit runs swift-drive-audit to find a errors in kern.log. It reports the list of drives which have errors. The devices which are used for Swift are verified for an error and then reported. The devices are not automatically unmounted.
If the disk errors occur the operator must perform the maintenance on the disk by removing the disk from the Swift cluster or replacing the disk with a new one.

p.note: Run Icinga check once in every 30 minutes for drive audit to complete one run on a large system.

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud.

section.title: Monitor Drive Audit
section.p: Perform the following steps to monitor the drive audit:

ol.li:
In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:
Username: icingaadmin
Password: icingaadmin

Click Status on the left panel and click Host Details.
The page navigates to the Host Status Details for all Hosts.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address> and displays the status of the audit drive of the selected Swift node.
